FuncDef:
The service-identify-policy command is need to band service identification policy on the BAS interface.
The undo service-identify-policy command is need to delete service identification policy on the BAS interface.
By default, no service identification policy is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a service identification policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In multi-play services, you can run the service-identify-policy command to identify Internet access traffic and to effectively manage bandwidth resources for such traffic.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The NE40E supports service identification for IPoE, and IPoEoQ access users.
To delete a service identification policy that is applied, you need to check the detailed binding relationship of the policy by running the display service-identify-policy command. After removing all binding relationships, you can delete the service identification policy by running the undo service-identify-policy command.
